jobs_results.title: Android Developer
jobs_results.description:
Company Description

We‚Äôre the world‚Äôs leading sports technology company, at the intersection between sports, media, and betting. More than 1,700 sports federations, media outlets, betting operators, and consumer platforms across 120 countries rely on our know-how and technology to boost their business.

Job Description

Are you ready to take your career to the next level by helping us build a product that millions of users use daily?

We support more than 100K transactions per second combined, and we are working for much more because we aim to be one of the top three e-gaming and betting software development companies recognised worldwide for adding the most value to its partners.

For this reason, we are looking for software engineers who are enthusiastic about building modern, resilient and scalable applications.

We need our engineers to be versatile, capable of mentoring and enthusiastic about taking on new challenges as we continue to push technology forward.

We are product-oriented engineers with a growth mindset.

Our products need to handle data at a vast scale and extend well beyond betting and gaming.

We are looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, data processing & storage, security, UX/UI design, and mobile; the list goes on and grows every day.

We are curious problem solvers; we collaborate, communicate, share knowledge and technical ideas, and thrive together.

We give you autonomy over the software you build and offer you the freedom to choose the right tools for the job.

OVERVIEW

As one of Android developers in Sportradar's MSS Unit your responsibility will be to develop Android Mobile applications with superior UX for the sport fans worldwide.

THE CHALLENGE
‚Ä¢ Develop state-of-the-art Android mobile applications leveraging Sportradar‚Äôs data.
‚Ä¢ Use newest development principles and frameworks recommended.
‚Ä¢ Cooperate with designers, testers and other developers to meet the required goals

YOUR PROFILE
‚Ä¢ You have at least two years experience with native Android development
‚Ä¢ You understand development standards and concepts
‚Ä¢ You understand Android development concept and know how to use Android SDK
‚Ä¢ You are familiar with Java and Kotlin
‚Ä¢ You are aware that unit tests make your life easier in the long term
‚Ä¢ You are always on the look for new technologies and are eager to try them out
‚Ä¢ You are fluent in English

OUR OFFER
‚Ä¢ A collaborative environment with colleagues from all over the world.
‚Ä¢ Ability to shape your own workday and career via a clearly defined professional and personal development plan.
‚Ä¢ Opportunity to work with senior leadership team and develop yourself within an inspiring and fast-growing company.
‚Ä¢ Vibrant and inclusive community, including Women in Tech and Pride groups which welcome all participants.
‚Ä¢ Hybrid work model.
‚Ä¢ Office with several additional benefits.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Maybe you will appreciate this information:
‚Ä¢ Part of Sportradar MSS Engineering (team of ~200)
‚Ä¢ Which is part of Sportradar.com (team of more than 3000)

We also offer:
‚Ä¢ Continuous learning program with technical internals sessions for continuous improvement.
‚Ä¢ Access to our online e-learning platform.
‚Ä¢ Internal training sessions during office hours to learn and grow.

Additional Information

Sportradar is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to encourage diversity within our teams. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to among other things, your background, status, or personal preferences

jobs_results.title: mySugr Senior Android Developer - Freelancer (m/f/d)
jobs_results.location: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Spain (+1 other)
jobs_results.description:
Diabetes is a pesky monster ‚Äî and that‚Äôs putting it mildly. If you‚Äôre serious about helping us face it head on, come join us! For a behind-the-scenes look, check out our Monster Culture Blog, this little video and Roche code4life to see what makes mySugr and Roche tick.

Here's what we're looking for:

Freelance (Full-time)

Developing mobile apps is great, but developing mobile apps with a purpose is even better! As a Software Engineer at Roche, you‚Äôll work on a product that helps people with the most precious thing they have ‚Äî their health. In collaborative teams of developers, designers, product owners, and QA experts, you‚Äôll experience best-in-class software development practices on a daily basis and contribute to software that meets the highest expectations ‚Äî we do not put our users' lives at risk!

We‚Äôre looking for a Freelance Senior Software Engineer (Android) who will have a significant impact on the software development process and moving your entire team forward. Your main contribution will be writing code while acting as a role model for the entire development team. You apply your experience in architectural and technical decision making, ensuring a high code quality and contribute your technical knowledge as a foundation for strategic product decisions, identifying and driving improvements of the product development process and its infrastructure.

Essential skills for this mission:
‚Ä¢ You have at least 5 years of experience working as a Software Engineer with good knowledge of Kotlin
‚Ä¢ You have a degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent technical knowledge
‚Ä¢ You are well acquainted with the Android platform and APIs
‚Ä¢ You have a passion for clean code and solid, future-proof architectures and you have testing in mind while you develop production code
‚Ä¢ You are able and open to learn new technologies and processes

What you will be working with:

We are always trying to stay on top of the game and use modern tools and approaches standardized across the industry.
‚Ä¢ Our codebase is Kotlin-first with usage of Dagger, Coroutines, reactive programming with Flows, Material design, ViewModel architecture and more
‚Ä¢ Unit tests and continuous integration is an important and integral part of our development process. We know there is no excuse not to write tests and the only way to go fast is to go well
‚Ä¢ You will learn about the wide range of technologies we employ, gaining a rich understanding of the specific requirements of medical software, be it security, medical risk management, safe and resilient programming, or certifications and audits

Here‚Äôs what you can expect from us:
‚Ä¢ Ambitious and passionate people building meaningful products
‚Ä¢ An innovative agile working environment allowing for collaboration with really smart people and knowledge sharing in cross-functional teams
‚Ä¢ We will provide all the necessary information and training about diabetes that every good Monster Tamer needs on their mission to ‚Äúmake diabetes suck less‚Äù

Who we are and what we care about:

Here at mySugr and Roche Diabetes Care we are committed to providing a healthy, equal and inclusive working environment for our Monster Tamers to help them make diabetes suck less! We care about family friendly career paths, sustainability, a healthy lifestyle and the flexibility of a modern workplace. We maintain a culture of learning and sharing, as well as open and candid feedback. At every level, there are many opportunities to develop and grow at mySugr - both professionally and personally.

Being a global leader in integrated Personalised Diabetes Management (iPDM), Roche Diabetes Care collaborates with pioneers around the globe, including people with diabetes, caregivers, healthcare professionals and payers. We aim to transform and advance care provision and foster sustainable care structures. Under the brands RocheDiabetes, Accu-Chek and mySugr, comprising glucose monitoring, insulin delivery systems and digital solutions, we unite with our partners to create patient-centred value. Our mission is to support the optimization of therapy and enable better informed therapy decisions. We build and collaborate in an open ecosystem, connect devices and digital solutions as well as contextualising relevant data points. Join us in our mission to make diabetes suck less and bring true relief to patients.

Interested? Great. We‚Äôd like to hear from you! Just click that ‚ÄúApply Now‚Äù button and send us your CV in English.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

jobs_results.title: Android Developer  in Madrid
jobs_results.description:
ANDROID DEVELOPER

Android, Kotlin, Java, Mobile development

Our client is a global fintech offering a cutting edge solution.

They are seeking an Android Developer to join them as they grow. This is a fully remote role offering generous holiday and shares.

Position overview

Tech stack includes:
‚Ä¢ 100% Kotlin
‚Ä¢ Architecture components
‚Ä¢ RxJava, Coroutines, Flow
‚Ä¢ Dagger, Koin
‚Ä¢ Kotlin Multiplatform
‚Ä¢ Compose

As an Android Developer you will collaborate closely with your fellow team members from product, backend, design and QA.

As Android Developer, day to day you will be responsible for building components of our mobile app that will enable users all over the world to send, spend, save, and receive money and Bitcoin safely and globally.

This is a great opportunity if you are a passionate, enthusiastic engineer interested in revolutionizing banking

Requirements
‚Ä¢ 3+ years experience in Android development.
‚Ä¢ Experience in Kotlin.
‚Ä¢ Experience working with code sharing, pull requests and code reviews (Git).
‚Ä¢ Experience working with teams in an agile environment (Jira).
‚Ä¢ Passion for clean code where re-usability, testability and readability are a must (SOLID).
‚Ä¢ Experience with the tech stack described above.
‚Ä¢ Great communication skills in English.

Nice to have
‚Ä¢ Experience in CI/CD, Gradle and static code quality analytics.
‚Ä¢ Experience in UI tests.
‚Ä¢ Experience in Kotlin Multiplatform.
‚Ä¢ Experience in material design and animations.
‚Ä¢ Experience or willingness to learn some Swift
‚Ä¢ Open source contributions.

jobs_results.title: Android Software Development Engineer | 100 % remote
jobs_results.description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: Spain

Job Description

We are looking for the very Top Talent‚Ä¶and we would be delighted if you were to join our team!

More in details, UST is a multinational company based in North America, certified as a Top Employer company with over 29.000 employees all over the world and presence in more than 30 countries. We are leaders on digital technology services, and we provide large-scale technologic solutions to big companies. **

What are we looking for?**

We're looking for an Android Software Development Engineer, this role will support the Dev Teams working as part of a multidisciplinary Engineering Team, delivering best-of-class software for our customers to use on their mobile devices; changing the way they interact with their finances. With excellent programming skills in a couple of languages and extensive commercial experience developing software for the Android platform (Kotlin/Java) - in an Agile environment - you‚Äôll be collaborating with product owners and designers on feature development, as well as mentoring other engineers and advising managers

100% remote position for candidates based in Spain **

Main Functions**
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôll work as part of a self-organised Mobile Engineering Team to design and develop software features that are delightful and vital to the lives of credit card consumers across all walks of life
‚Ä¢ Your focus is on a major portion of existing or new team software (e.g., significant component, set of features, mid-size application or service)
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôll work to achieve the goals and vision shared by Product Management and your Tribe Leadership
‚Ä¢ Innovate within your team, initiative area and contribute within your technical domain

Main Skills Required
‚Ä¢ Very strong programming skills with a good working knowledge of Kotlin or Java and modern Android toolsets like Android Studio, JUnit and Espresso
‚Ä¢ Experience with AWS Services
‚Ä¢ People who can effectively communicate and work together across different engineering areas
‚Ä¢ People with proven ability to deliver high quality applications at scale
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôre an advocate for quality and can support the team leveraging approaches such as Pair Programming, TDD and BDD What you‚Äôll get to learn (previous experience is a plus)
‚Ä¢ Working with the cloud/AWS and the opportunities that it brings in depth
‚Ä¢ Solving real world problems and being comfortable working in a complex regulated environment
‚Ä¢ Fluent in English

Valuable and desirable: being entitled of Disability Certificate (at least 33% score) **

What can we offer?**
‚Ä¢ 23 days of Annual Leave plus the 24th and 31st of December as discretionary days!
‚Ä¢ Numerous benefits (Health Care Plan, teleworking compensation, Life and Accident Insurances).
‚Ä¢ `Retribuci√≥n Flexible¬¥ Program: (Meals, Kinder Garden, Transport, online English lessons, Health Care Plan‚Ä¶)
‚Ä¢ Free access to several training platforms
‚Ä¢ Professional stability and career plans
‚Ä¢ UST also, compensates referrals from which you could benefit when you refer professionals.
‚Ä¢ The option to pick between 12 or 14 payments along the year.
‚Ä¢ Real Work Life Balance measures (flexibility, WFH or remote work policy, compacted hours during summertime‚Ä¶)
‚Ä¢ UST Club Platform discounts and gym Access discounts

If you would like to know more, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply and we‚Äôll get in touch to fill you in detail. We are waiting for you!

This offer from "UST" has been enriched by Jobgether.com and got a 72% flex score.

jobs_results.title: Senior Android Engineer
jobs_results.description:
Mondly by Pearson

Role: Senior Android Developer

Location: Spain, Remote

Pearson

At Pearson, we‚Äôre committed to a world that‚Äôs always learning and to our talented team who makes it all possible. We are bold thinkers and standout innovators who motivate each other to explore new frontiers in an environment that supports and inspires us to always be better. With a rich heritage that combines 150 years of experience in publishing with the latest learning technology and digital services, we help people learn whatever, wherever and however they choose.

Role Overview

The Senior Android Developer will design and develop mobile applications for the company‚Äôs line of learning products. To be successful in this essential role you must have strong knowledge in Android development and the ability to work autonomously. The Employee will have proven experience in applying new technologies and solutions to drive engaging consumer-grade applications, ideally in a learning environment.

The Senior Android Developer will be part of an Agile development team responsible for building innovative, high-performance, scalable native applications using latest technologies and frameworks and integrating third-party SDKs. The Employee will be responsible for the development and maintenance of applications aimed at a range of Android devices including mobile phones and tablets.

The Employee will report to the Engineering Manager and operate as part of the Technology team, unless the Employer determines otherwise.

Key Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Technical Excellence:
‚Ä¢ Design, develop, unit test, and deploy medium and high complexity Android based solutions using common standards and frameworks.
‚Ä¢ Create & execute automation test strategy for mobile apps across Android platforms.
‚Ä¢ Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
‚Ä¢ Organize peer code- reviews to spot problems and ensure quality of the product. Offer guidance to less senior members of the team on how to improve code quality and efficiency.
‚Ä¢ Participate in and champion a highly collaborative, customer-centric, data-driven culture that challenges norms with a bias to action; support diversity of thoughts, experiences, and approaches to solve issues.
‚Ä¢ Duly observe all applicable health and safety laws and regulations.
‚Ä¢ Collaboration:
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with the product delivery team to define, design, and ship new features.
‚Ä¢ Work with designers, backend engineers and product managers to deliver an optimized product and exceptional user experience.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with the product delivery team to ensure technical feasibility for new features and enhancements to the existing features.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with product managers and designers to create prototypes for new and enhanced features.
‚Ä¢ Promote a culture of partnership, teamwork, innovation and diversity, equity, and inclusion.
‚Ä¢ Partner with other Senior iOS Developers in solving complex challenges in building best-in-class features and product enhancements.
‚Ä¢ Delivery:
‚Ä¢ Manage concurrent project efforts, and work both independently and in a team environment.
‚Ä¢ Scale the Android team processes; improve release pipeline, build automation and monitoring.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrate solid knowledge and understanding of continuous integration.
‚Ä¢ Prioritize and estimate tasks efficiently, ensuring that scheduled launches happen according to planning. Help more junior team members with their time estimations if needed.

Qualifications & Skills
‚Ä¢ More than 4 years of experience in Android development, with a proven track record of building successful mobile applications.
‚Ä¢ Strong object-oriented design, programming, and debugging skills.
‚Ä¢ Ability to identify blockers and solve them with the appropriate stakeholders.
‚Ä¢ Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment.
‚Ä¢ Deep understanding of Kotlin, as well as Coroutines and Flow.
‚Ä¢ Experience with the MVVM architecture pattern and Clean Architecture.
‚Ä¢ Great experience in both XML layouts and Compose.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of the Firebase platform.
‚Ä¢ Experience with Android data repositories and libraries such as SQLite and Room.
‚Ä¢ Experience with Retrofit.
‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of the full mobile development life cycle.
‚Ä¢ Excellent fluency in English, both spoken and written.

Desirable
‚Ä¢ Degree in Informatics, Computer Science, or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.
‚Ä¢ Deep understanding of Dependency Injection, with a special focus on Dagger Hilt.
‚Ä¢ Experience with SQLCypher, Protobuf and gRPC.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with continuous integration, continuous deployment, and automated testing.

What to expect from Pearson

Did you know Pearson is one of the 10 most innovative education companies of 2022?

At Pearson, we add life to a lifetime of learning so everyone can realize the life they imagine. We do this by creating vibrant and enriching learning experiences designed for real-life impact. We are on a journey to be 100 percent digital to meet the changing needs of the global population by developing a new strategy with ambitious targets. To deliver on our strategic vision, we have five business divisions that are the foundation for the long-term growth of the company: Assessment & Qualifications, Virtual Learning, English Language Learning, Workforce Skills and Higher Education. Alongside these, we have our corporate divisions: Digital & Technology, Finance, Global Corporate Marketing & Communications, Human Resources, Legal, Strategy and Direct to Consumer. Learn more at We are Pearson.

We value the power of an inclusive culture and also a strong sense of belonging. We promote a culture where differences are embraced, opportunities are accessible, consideration and respect are the norm and all individuals are supported in reaching their full potential. Through our talent, we believe that diversity, equity and inclusion make us a more innovative and vibrant place to work. People are at the center, and we are committed to building a workplace where talent can learn, grow and thrive.

Pearson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and a member of E-Verify. We want a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit and business need.‚ÄØAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status or any other group protected by law. We strive for a workforce that reflects the diversity of our communities.

To learn more about Pearson‚Äôs commitment to a diverse and inclusive workforce, navigate to: Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Pearson.

If you are an individual with a disability and are unable or limited in your ability to use or access our career site as a result of your disability, you may request reasonable accommodations by emailing TalentExperienceGlobalTeam@grp.pearson.com.

Note that the information you provide will stay confidential and will be stored securely. It will not be seen by those involved in making decisions as part of the recruitment process.

jobs_results.title: Android Developer
jobs_results.description:
Si tienes la costumbre de utilizar transporte p√∫blico para desplazarte seguro que has probado aplicaciones como Uber, Bolt o Cabify. Pero, ¬øqu√© pasa entonces con los taxis? Imbric , la app de Spartan Sys ha creado una soluci√≥n de movilidad digitalizada para que puedas moverte en taxi, bus o moto y pagar el parking o la zona azul con una sola aplicaci√≥n. Hac√≠a falta, ¬øverdad? Pues buscan ampliar el equipo con un/a Android Developer.

Spartan Sys es la compa√±√≠a responsable de Imbric, una aplicaci√≥n dual. Es decir, existe una app de usuario final disponible en la App Store y en la Play Store , pero adem√°s, los conductores profesionales tambi√©n tienen su app (en este caso solo para Android) en la que registran sus recorridos, horarios, disponibilidad, etc.

Desde la aplicaci√≥n de usuario puedes pedir un taxi, comprar billetes de autob√∫s o reservar motos compartidas, adem√°s de pagar el parking o la zona azul. Todo de manera sencilla.

¬øY qu√© ha pasado durante los √∫ltimos meses? El verano pasado la Mutua Madrile√±a adquiri√≥ Imbric, que sigue funcionando de manera independiente pero ahora pertenece a la gran familia de La Mutua.

Se encuentran en un momento de impulso y crecimiento, ampliando las funcionalidades de la aplicaci√≥n y el equipo necesita la incorporaci√≥n de un/a Android Developer con experiencia que se haga cargo de ambas aplicaciones: la de clientes finales y la de conductores.
¬øC√≥mo es el producto?

La aplicaci√≥n est√° desarrollada en iOS y en Android. Principalmente, el desarrollo Android es Java para mobile, aunque les gustar√≠a migrar en un medio plazo a Kotlin.

Te formar√°s con el desarrollador actual que ha llevado a cabo los desarrollos en Android, ya que √©l estar√° destinado a otro proyecto durante bastante meses y se va a encargar m√°s del backend. Ser√°s su padawan durante los primeros meses para entender la arquitectura de la aplicaci√≥n, los procesos y los servicios y el roadmap de 2023.

Todo est√° desplegado en AWS y quieren incorporar una estrategia de testing durante este a√±o. Ahora mismo trabajan con test unitarios, pero les gustar√≠a testear de manera autom√°tica tambi√©n las apps.

El equipo todav√≠a es lo suficientemente peque√±o para ser muy horizontal y familiar. Son unas 14 personas a d√≠a de hoy m√°s Javier, el CTO a quien conocer√°s durante el proceso.
¬øQu√© reto tienen delante?

En tu caso concreto, te enfocar√°s en los nuevos desarrollos para Android, por lo que esperan cierta experiencia desarrollando aplicaciones y poni√©ndolas en producci√≥n. Adem√°s de mejorar y mantener los desarrollos actuales de ambas aplicaciones.

El trabajo es constante porque la Play Store se actualiza de manera constante. Se deprecan cosas de manera constante y hay que mantener las aplicaciones actualizadas.

Adem√°s, cuando los PM detectan nuevas funcionalidades, hacen sesiones conjuntas de grooming para definir el trabajo a llevar a cabo y la arquitectura.

Tu primer d√≠a
En 1 mes

Durante el primer mes, tu foco ser√° la formaci√≥n y el conocimiento del producto. De la mano de varios compa√±eros entender√°s c√≥mo funcionan las aplicaciones, las perspectivas de 2023 y c√≥mo ser√° tu d√≠a a d√≠a. Al acabar este primer mes, tendr√°s una visi√≥n general de la compa√±√≠a y del producto y ya habr√°s empezado a trabajar en algunos desarrollos de Android.

Desarrollar√°s nuevas funcionalidades en Java para las dos aplicaciones de Imbric: clientes y conductores.

Te asegurar√°s de hacerlo con un c√≥digo limpio, robusto y escalable.

Dise√±ar√°s, desarrollar√°s, validar√°s y desplegar√°s funcionalidades junto con el resto del equipo.

Tendr√°s una mente abierta para conocer nuevas tecnolog√≠as dentro de su stack.

A nivel metodol√≥gico, trabajan bajo un modelo de Scrum con sus dailies, retros y sprint plannings. Los sprints son bisemanales y todo se organiza mediante un backlog de tareas priorizadas.

Para que entiendas el producto al completo, el backend est√° desarrollado en Java con Hibernate, Spring y Struts. Utilizan diferentes bases de datos, en funci√≥n de lo que necesitan los servicios: Redis, MySQL, Aurora y DynamoDB. Y en el front se encuentran en plena migraci√≥n de Angular a React.

Y despu√©s, algo tan b√°sico como Git para el control de versiones, Jira para las tareas, RabbitMQ como herramienta de mensajer√≠a de colas y CodeBuild y CodePipelines para la integraci√≥n cont√≠nua.

La jornada es totalmente flexible . Solo te piden estar en la daily que suele ser a las 9:30 excepto en verano que la hacen a las 9:00 para terminar antes. El resto del d√≠a, t√∫ puedes organizarte el tiempo como quieras siempre y cuando llegues a los objetivos de la iteraci√≥n.

La idea es que te puedas distribuir el horario a tu manera, siendo responsable y trabajando con autonom√≠a para con tus objetivos.
D√≠a laborable
Vacaciones

Vacaciones
25 d√≠as
Jornada laboral
Presencial

La posici√≥n es 100% remota, por lo que mientras te asegures que tienes buena conexi√≥n, podr√°s trabajar desde casa o desde Honolul√∫ Ô∏è.

La oficina de Madrid est√° abierta todos los d√≠as para quien prefieren trabajar all√≠, as√≠ que si eres de Madrid ¬°no dudes en pasarte a conocer al equipo!

Ahora mismo son 14 personas en el equipo y estos son algunos de los compa√±eros con los que m√°s interactuar√°s en tu d√≠a a d√≠a son:
‚Ä¢ Javier(CTO): con muchos a√±os y muchas guerras en la espalda, buen conocedor y tecn√≥logo entusiasta.
‚Ä¢ Lu√≠s √Ålvarez (Product Owner):un m√°quina del paddle al que no se le escapa ni una bola.

jobs_results.title: Senior Android Developer in a very well-funded new startup - Madrid
jobs_results.description:
09 - December - 2016

The Challenge

The road transportation industry has been stuck in the same way of doing things for the past 30 years, with complex over-the-phone transactions that could be sped up and more efficient using the right technology. Our client is a new European start-up devoted to bringing the road transportation industry to the 21st century. They realised that, despite how present mobile technology is in our day-to-day lives, it hasn't yet reached such a critical industry. Their initial product is a B2B platform to streamline the finding of the right carrier for your freight. You can think of it as an Uber for trucks.

The team
‚Ä¢ Every one of us has had several start-up experiences and on average we have 10+ years of experience in somehow similar challenges. We know success, we know failure; we've built platforms from scratch, we've dealt with large legacy systems. We care about each other and about the product we're building.
‚Ä¢ Some of the past projects where our engineers have been involved before joining us are: building the billing system for one of the largest telephony operators in Spain, building up and optimising complex marketplaces handling millions of orders a month, building real time video chats, building a global identity provider, improving the garbage collector of the JVM, creating social network libraries even before Facebook existed, building the Eurofighter simulator used to train pilots, building kernel modules to deal with real-time processor allocation, creating NLP algorithms to score user comments and timeline recommendation algorithms, building software to manage a backbone network and dealt with the logistic platform of a big supermarket chain.
‚Ä¢ Investors like our concept and team and we've been quite successful in fundraising and gathering resources to support our future growth.

The engineering culture
‚Ä¢ We value speed of iteration and best practices and we care about our craft: both our API and key JavaScript code have 100% test coverage, for instance.
‚Ä¢ We get engineers as close to the business problems as possible, so everybody can be involved in product decisions. We have mechanisms to enable anybody in the company to bring their new ideas to decision makers since we believe that innovative ideas come from everywhere.

The stack
‚Ä¢ We have a decoupled architecture, based on REST APIs and asynchronous services. We work with React in the frontend platforms (customers and admin), native in mobile apps (drivers), Python/Django in the backend and we're currently evaluating Elixir for some services. Our DB is PostgreSQL and the queues run on RabbitMQ.
‚Ä¢ We use a dedicated ERP to avoid reinventing the wheel there and we also have built a DWH/Analytics platform which takes advantage of external solutions.

The profile
‚Ä¢ You're not afraid of tough challenges, both product-wise and technical, and like to contribute your views.
‚Ä¢ You've built complex apps, apps from scratch, apps alone, apps in a team. You know all the tricks of the trade and are absolutely comfortable developing, testing, deploying and debugging Android apps.
‚Ä¢ You care about both the UX and the technical aspects of an app and follow industry trends and app development innovations.
‚Ä¢ You care about the product you're building and the problem you're solving, not just about the technology you're using. You pride yourself in choosing the best technical solution for a problem by taking all constraints into account.
‚Ä¢ You prefer working in a fast-paced start-up, with quick iterations, changes of direction, tight budgets, and chaos over a hierarchical, well-structured corporation with clear and well-defined assignments, and career paths.

The offer
‚Ä¢ An office in downtown Madrid (Chamber√≠).
‚Ä¢ A laid-back culture where everybody is encouraged to participate in discussions and contribute.
‚Ä¢ Opportunities for personal growth and learning (we hold regular tech talks and encourage working on different parts of the platform).
‚Ä¢ Good salaries and stock options packages. We want our engineers to have ownership and participate in company success.
‚Ä¢ Flexible schedule (though no regular remote working since we believe in face-to-face communication).

Contact

Sebastien Sanz, Ayova Executive Search | sebastien@ayova.com (ref: "OT1216")
